Question.question_title: Create a new list column based on conditions with data.table
Question.question_text:
I currently have a table that has the following column:
ID, Letter_Date, Dates_for_ID
with the formats:
Chr, Date, list(of dates)
I want to create a new column that has a revised list of dates where the dates are the ones in the list IF before the 'Date' column
I have tried looping as below:
This approach works but is extremely slow - I was wondering what a quicker way of doing it is?
I have looked at map with purrr but unsure how it would work here. 
df$Revised_List<-vector('list', nrow(df)) 

and 
for (i in 1:nrow(df)) {
 df$Revised_List[i]<- list(df$Dates_for_ID[[i]][df$Letter_Date[i]>df$Dates_for_id[[i]]) 
}

I would ideally like an ouptut as list column with the new dates.

Question.question_title: using swift can we airplay photos on Apple TV programmatically?
Question.question_text:
I want to build a simple app in iOS using swift which shows the photos of the album in my app and on button click it should airplay on my Apple TV.
I read so many documents and articles but not sure if we can do it for photos. Few have said for audio/video it is possible but not sure about photos.
At least any links or sample code would be helpful.
Thanks
